page.title: 12SHEEP FARMING : CANNICH AREA
page.content: {Sheep farming}in the area consists mainly of{Scotch Blackface}with a few {Cheviots. }On most farms the younger Blackface Ewes are bred pure while older ones are mated with Border Leicester and Suffolk rams to produce a bigger lamb. Some flocks are maintained totally on hill land, some part hill part arable and some on arable alone. Annual Autumn culling of hill ewes provides a certain amount of sheep for low ground farms where cross breeding is the system followed. Many lambs, especially from hill land, are sold at store auctions, like the calves, but a certain amount are reared to "finishing point" i.e. butchering conditions. In the last few years entire flocks have been sold from some hill areas and the ground left to deer alone.
